text:
Hello!

I have some trouble reading a CSV file:
```using TimeSeries
array = readtimearray("mini.csv", format="yyyymmddHHMMss", delim=',')```
results in:
```BoundsError: attempt to access 0-element Array{Float64,1} at index [1]```
mini.csv:
```Timestamp,Open,High,Low,Close,Volume,Ticksinbar
20100101150000,1.43337,1.43349,1.43329,1.43334,43.3999991,17```
I think it parses timestamp to a float which cannot be converted to a DateTime;

readtimearray uses
```    cfile = readdlm(source, delim, header = header)```
to read the csv. Is there a way I can convince to leave it as a string?

elements.text:
Hello!

I have some trouble reading a CSV file:

using TimeSeries
array = readtimearray("mini.csv", format="yyyymmddHHMMss", delim=',')
BoundsError: attempt to access 0-element Array{Float64,1} at index [1]

I think it parses timestamp to a float which cannot be converted to a DateTime;

readtimearray uses
to read the csv. Is there a way I can convince to leave it as a string?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56211| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Just a guess, but try removing the empty line after the header?

elements.text: Just a guess, but try removing the empty line after the header?

text: in the .csv there is no empty line after the header

elements.text: in the .csv there is no empty line after the header
